SD_ROM_NightWithMinsc.synopsis: After the goblin hunt celebration party, this companion has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction.synopsis: Introspection moment with companion inclusion after the combat of the Drow betrayal. The player may or may not have slept with the drow that betrayed and attacked us in the camp.

SCO_DrowBetrayal.synopsis: Minthara ambushes a player during the night, standing over them with a knife. This can occur almost immediately after sleeping with her, in which case she regrets what she is about to do, and can be convinced not to go through with it.
SCO_DrowBetrayal.how_to_trigger: Recon (in order):1. oe readyattackonden2. oe attackondenraidervictory3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_GoblinPartyInvitation4. Roll amazing5. Go to camp6. Talk to Minthara. A mindmeld seduction scene will happen. Agree to spend the night with her.7. Go to bed8. Choose to spend the night with Minthara, and sex scene will happen.9.  Dialog will trigger after.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion.synopsis: After the goblin hunt celebration party (whether the player helped the goblins or the tieflings), Astarion has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night. For Astarion, this is a game of power - one he's played many times before in the taverns of Baldur's Gate, trying to lure people back to his master. He's an old hand at seduction, very self-assured at first, but the player might not go along with the script he expects them to follow. The next morning, the player wakes to see Astarion standing and getting dressed. They catch a glimpse of scars on his back - a sore point. The scars were carved into him by his old master. As far as Astarion knows, they're a poem, but he's never been able to read it (can't look in a mirror, after all).

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart.synopsis: After the goblin hunt celebration party, this companion has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter.synopsis: Halsin approaches you the morning after you celebrated your victory over the goblins. He now turns to the matter of your tadpole and how you might cure yourself - there is no quick solution, however. He tells you it'll be necessary to travel to a dangerous new region, and joins you at your camp to provide support.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Aoe readyattackondengoto 297.75, 35.51, -25.25Kill True Soul Gut1Kill Dror Ragzlinoe debugbook > go to region > act1 > groveBlow war horn to trigger raidKill Mintharagoto 399.91, 33.02, -29.76kill combat > Speak to Halsin / or halsin should have escapedgo back to grove to witness zevlor speech + halsins arrivalgo to camp + long restdialog should trigger after rest

SD_SelectNight.synopsis: When player chooses to sleep after goblin hunt celebration, this narration dialogue occurs. If Minthara does not have a partner, she will attempt to talk with an avatar who hasn't refused her directly.Note: the player might be meeting up with Lae'zel or Astarion for a second time after sleeping with them before in the past.The reflection moments are for characters who the player may have already done the romance for, who don't have a romance tied to the overnight (only Wyll), or who don't have a second romance scene available overnight if you did the first (anyone other than Laezel and Astarion).
SD_SelectNight.how_to_trigger: Use a bedroll during the celebration.

CFM_Raiders.synopsis: Celebration with the goblins in camp after victory in attack on den.
CFM_Raiders.how_to_trigger: from crashsite:in reCon: oe readyattackondenoe attackondenraidervictorySetGlobalOsirisFlag DEN_AttackOnDen_Event_GoblinPartyInvitationgo to camp

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow.synopsis: After the goblin hunt celebration party, the Drow Commander Minthara has made arrangements to get intimate with the player at night.After the sex scene, Minthara becomes troubled. She realises that while she's with the player she cannot hear the voice of the Absolute... which is liberating, and disturbing. This, unknown to her, is because of the Astral Prism's influence.

SD_ROM_NightWithMinsc_2.speaker: Minsc
SD_ROM_NightWithMinsc_2.text: |Sex is optional, but if your origin does have sex in this scene, please set these object flags: ORI_HadSexWithRufus AND ORI_HadSexWithCompanion, as these are checked elsewhere. Thank you!|

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_9.speaker: Narrator
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_9.text: *The campsite is secure. Blood-soaked, but secure.*

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_5.speaker: Gale
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_5.text: Minthara. To sleep with her is to dream of death. Plenty of that to go around.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_10.speaker: Gale
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_10.text: Bloodshed by day, bloodshed by night. What a jolly bloody life we lead.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_0.speaker: Lae'zel
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_0.text: First you sow, now you reap. I trust you shall be more selective going forward, lest it's your blood I spill.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_4.speaker: Player
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_4.text: What's done is done - but we should check the corpses for valuables.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_6.speaker: Lae'zel
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_6.text: Leave the corpses be, let the maggots feast. Our betrayers deserve no better.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_7.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_7.text: Talk about having your cake then killing it. I hope all your romantic liaisons don't end this way.
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_7.context: NodeContext: A little tipsy (this continues from the goblin hunt celebration scene where Shadowheart seems to be hitting the bottle a little hard)

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_8.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_8.text: That's one way to end a party. Let's mop up the goblin leftovers and get some rest.
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_8.context: NodeContext: A little tipsy (this continues from the goblin hunt celebration scene where Shadowheart seems to be hitting the bottle a little hard)

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_3.speaker: Astarion
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_3.text: Well. I hope your romp was worth it.
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'well' - you're looking over a camp strewn with fresh corpses, quite a few of which you killed. You had fun, but the player did fuck the person that betrayed and attacked them.

CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_11.speaker: Astarion
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_11.text: What a party. We should do this again.
CFM_DrowBetrayalReaction_11.context: NodeContext: You're looking over a camp strewn with fresh corpses, many of which you killed. You had fun. This was an actual party that turned into an ambush.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_24.speaker: Narrator
SCO_DrowBetrayal_24.text: *In your dream, you stand over yourself as you sleep. A knife in your hand, murder in your heart.*
SCO_DrowBetrayal_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara approaches the sleeping player, standing over them, a knife comes into frame (1st Person)NodeContext: confusion

SCO_DrowBetrayal_49.speaker: Narrator
SCO_DrowBetrayal_49.text: *You are ready to strike, to end your own life - but then a shock runs through your mind. This is no dream.*
SCO_DrowBetrayal_49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Minthara pulls back the knife, ready to plunge it down, but there's a slight hesitation and the player wakes with a start
~Cut to the player squirming out from Minthara standing over them, getting to the their feet to realized they're surrounded by goblins.NodeContext: urgency on first phrases - 'but then' turns to dawning horror

SCO_DrowBetrayal_52.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_52.text: Wake up, True Soul. We must talk.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: standing by our bedroll, knife in hand, watching us as we sleep

SCO_DrowBetrayal_27.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_27.text: I watched over you as you slept, peaceful and silent, and I spoke to our god.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_14.text: I asked Her why She had chosen you, made you one of Her faithful, when you are so clearly broken. Beautiful, but broken.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_58.text: There is something missing in you, and I do not understand it.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_13.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_13.text: When the Absolute failed to answer me, I feared that you had somehow infected me with that same absence.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_16.text: And so I decided that you must die.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_7.text: But then a miracle happened. As I took out my blade, Her voice returned to me... and She told me what I must do to purge myself of doubt.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_7.context: NodeContext: genuine awe of the religious experience

SCO_DrowBetrayal_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_1.text: She told me to decide your fate, to determine if you are worthy. If you are, I am to send you into Her embrace, at the seat of Her power.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_1.context: NodeContext: genuine awe of the religious experience

SCO_DrowBetrayal_69.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_69.text: I only wish to please the Absolute - send me to Her.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_68.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_68.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

SCO_DrowBetrayal_8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_8.text: Travel to Moonrise. We will meet again there, at the heart of the Absolute's power.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_77.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_77.text: Why would I follow that path when you just threatened to kill me?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_2.text: If She wanted you dead, I would not spare you. You live by Her grace.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_43.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_43.text: When you meet Her at Moonrise, She will show you Her design, and your part in it.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_15.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_15.text: You said the Absolute demanded my death - why?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_4.text: I do not know - but I do know that She allowed me to spare you.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_10.text: To gather our forces in this region. They're ill-disciplined - without a strong hand, they'll disperse.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_47.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_47.text: The heart of power - what is this Moonrise, exactly?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_74.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_74.text: The Absolute has spoken to you already, in whispers, but at Moonrise you will be in Her presence.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_30.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_30.text: Wrong. The Absolute brought you to me, and now She will take you into Her presence at Moonrise.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_30.context: NodeContext: First word harsh and mocking. Then sinister and ominous

SCO_DrowBetrayal_73.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_73.text: And you will provide a safe journey, as you promised?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_0.text: I know a way, yes. Soon, you will be in the Absolute's presence.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_34.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_34.text: She will test you. If you fail, you will break; if your faith is strong, you will become something even more beautiful.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_34.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power - affection on the final phrase; we only hear this if we are in a romance with her

SCO_DrowBetrayal_6.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_6.text: I'm ready. How do I get there?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_5.text: With difficulty - but I can help.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_79.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_79.text: The land around Moonrise is cursed. Travelling there will sap your strength and your sanity.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_40.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_40.text: But I can protect you. A wretched creature in my service can guide you through the curse.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_23.text: This harp will summon him. Play it when you are in the shadows, and he will come to you and know that you are a friend.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_78.text: He was a drow once. Now he is an abomination, a victim of Lolth's cruelty.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_82.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_82.text: His minions will wait for you at the mountain pass, on the threshold of the shadow curse.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_81.text: I warn you - he is quite mad, but he knows the path to Moonrise better than anyone.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_36.text: Go to him when you are ready. I will lead what remains of my forces to Moonrise ahead of you.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_29.text: When we next meet, we will be together in the Absolute's presence, and She will make us Her champions.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_31.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_31.text: I'm not sure I'm ready for this.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_45.text: Then steel yourself. If you are uncertain, you will not even survive the journey.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_54.text: She will test you. If you fail, you will break; if your faith is strong, you will become something greater than yourself.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_54.context: NodeContext: seductive and sinister - the lure and fear of dark power

SCO_DrowBetrayal_75.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_75.text: Can you tell me how to reach Moonrise safely?

SCO_DrowBetrayal_83.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_83.text: I met True Soul Nere in the Underdark. He warned me against working with you.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_61.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_61.text: Did he, now? Let me guess: the snivelling brat's failed his duty. Nothing if not expected.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_20.text: I wish that were true. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_37.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_37.text: We're both worthy. Let's go to the Absolute together.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_33.text: In time, I believe we may be together.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_33.context: NodeContext: pleased that our fate is decided, and we can be spared

SCO_DrowBetrayal_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_3.text: I believed for a moment that we might share a path. But I still sense that absence inside you... and I fear it.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_35.text: I take no pleasure in what I must do. In another life, I would have taken you as my consort in Menzoberranzan.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_22.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_22.text: I prefer to decide my own fate.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_21.text: Then you do not belong to the Absolute.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_21.context: NodeContext: sad, our fate is decided, and she must kill us

SCO_DrowBetrayal_64.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_64.text: If I go to the seat of Her power, it will be to destroy Her.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_55.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_55.text: Then you have chosen. Whatever you truly are, you will die before you can do anymore harm.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_55.context: NodeContext: determined,  our fate is decided, and she must kill us

SCO_DrowBetrayal_80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_80.text: Good - you are awake. I want to taste your fear, just as you tasted mine.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_80.context: NodeContext: Preparing to kill us while we rest - strong emphasis on 'your' to contrast her fear and ours. She's referring back to a specific event when we saw her afraid. Malicious

SCO_DrowBetrayal_42.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_42.text: You'd try kill me? I AM THE ABSOLUTE'S FIST!

SCO_DrowBetrayal_50.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_50.text: That might be. But you have not been truly tested yet.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_50.context: NodeContext: angry, but coming round to our way of thinking

SCO_DrowBetrayal_56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_56.text: But you will be, and soon. I am curious to see if you survive.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_26.text: You've played your part. The glory for this victory will be mine alone.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_26.context: NodeContext: Preparing to call her minions to kill us - malicious satisfaction

SCO_DrowBetrayal_84.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_84.context: NodeContext: turns her back on the player, shouting to goblins that are all around

SCO_DrowBetrayal_39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_39.context: NodeContext: turns her back on the player, shouting to goblins that are all around

SCO_DrowBetrayal_48.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_48.text: Don't make this personal. I am a servant of the Absolute, same as you.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_72.speaker: Player
SCO_DrowBetrayal_72.text: You wouldn't dare kill me - I'm a True Soul, same as you.

SCO_DrowBetrayal_38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_38.context: NodeContext: angry - we just called her a coward, she's denying it but the truth stings a little

SCO_DrowBetrayal_41.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SCO_DrowBetrayal_41.text: Good - you are awake. I want to taste your fear.
SCO_DrowBetrayal_41.context: NodeContext: Malicious - preparing to kill us

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_164.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_164.text: There you are. I've been waiting.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_164.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player walks through the forest, Astarion emerges from the shadowsNodeContext: Walking forward, out of the shadows

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_197.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_197.text: Waiting since the moment I set eyes on you.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_197.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion walks slowly toward the player, stoping very closeNodeContext: Slowly approaching the player

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_23.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_23.context: NodeContext: Very close to the player

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_260.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_260.text: Don't I? You're here. And I don't think you want to talk.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_18.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_18.text: I think you want to be known. To be tasted.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_1.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_1.text: What do any of us want? Pleasure.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_258.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_258.text: That's what you want, isn't it? To lose yourself in me?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_266.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_266.context: NodeContext: with satisfaction, he's 'winning' at seduction

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_250.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_250.text: I want to have fun - that's it.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_280.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~STRONG: Astarion picks up the player, who straddles his waist, leaning them up against a tree. Fangs flashing. (Leave a neutral shot in the middle where they disrobe during the carry)

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~SHORT: Astarion picks up the player, who straddles his waist, leaning them up against a tree. The Fangs flashing  (Leave a neutral shot in the middle where they disrobe during the carry)

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_148.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~TALL: Astarion picks up the player, who straddles his waist, leaning them up against a tree. Fangs flashing. (Leave a neutral shot in the middle where they disrobe during the carry)

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_242.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_242.text: Relax. Enjoy yourself. Trust him not to bite you.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Astarion smiles, turns and lays the player down on the ground in one motion. Kissing their player on their chest, then the side of their rib. The player turns onto their side and Astarion slides in behind, ending with one long, kiss on the small of their neck before slideing his hand over the spot he kissed and inserting himself. The player responds with pleasure and their hand comes up to cover Astarions. Cut wide to show the imbrace, then a cloud passing over the moon.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_75.context: InternalNodeContext: Minthara intends to ambush the player at camp while they're sleeping

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_244.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player wakes alone, sitting up. Astarion has already risen stands letting the light hit his shirtless body, before leaning over to put a shirt on. As he leans over the player notes scars on his back. The scars are arranged not random, like writing.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_114.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_114.text: Interesting scars. Where'd you get them?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_171.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_171.text: That's Cazador's poem on your back? Written in scars?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_110.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_110.text: Believe it or not, I did. You're certainly... different.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_110.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach and Astarion didn't touch.NodeContext: With warmth and a bit of surprise in himself.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_90.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_90.text: But we should probably get back before we're missed. People might talk.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_90.context: NodeContext: A bit of warmth in his voice, but he's also being a little lowkey rejecting.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_87.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_87.text: You sleep light. I thought you'd be exhausted.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_87.context: NodeContext: ignoring the question 'not staying for a cuddle'? He thought he'd be gone before you woke up.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_229.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_229.text: How dare you - I'm a consummate lover.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_71.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_71.text: I was holding back, if anything. Worried that I might... lose control.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_239.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_239.text: Delicious as you were, I didn't want to go too far.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_239.context: NodeContext: 'delicious' = partially referring to sex, partially referring to drinking your blood

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_45.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_45.text: Now, shall we head back? We should try to get some rest before the sun comes up.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_184.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_184.text: I wanted to ask about your scars first. Where'd you get them?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_30.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_30.text: My past isn't exactly a happy story.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_248.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_248.text: I told you that I was a magistrate in Baldur's Gate, but that's only part of it.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_200.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_200.text: The mind flayers weren't my first kidnapping. A long time ago, I crossed Cazador - a powerful man in Baldur's Gate.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_14.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_14.text: He captured me. Kept me for years as his slave.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_190.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_190.text: And he gave you those scars?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_182.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_182.text: Yes. It's a poem. My old master considered himself quite the artist.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_257.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_257.text: Cazador said the scars were his gift. A poem to carry with me.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_257.context: NodeContext: A little grimly. Not a happy topic

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_97.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_97.text: That was my second kidnapping, when the mind flayers snatched me up.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_243.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_243.text: Not a great improvement, but at least they didn't mutilate me.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_205.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_205.text: It's a poem. A gift from Cazador. He considered himself quite the artist and used his slaves as a canvas.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_205.context: NodeContext: A little grimly. Not a happy topic

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_185.speaker: Astarion
