SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_37.context: NodeContext: Masking defensiveness with offensiveness. In truth he really does want what Karlach is offering (to just hang out without having sex) but now that it's within grasp he's floundering.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_236.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_236.text: Urgh! Why is this so difficult? I'd have already bedded you twice if you were normal.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_236.context: NodeContext: Masking defensiveness with offensiveness. In truth he really does want what Karlach is offering (to just hang out without having sex) but now that it's within grasp he's floundering. He's blaming her for his feelings of confusion.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_6.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_6.text: Twice in this short space of time? Doesn't sound very satisfying.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_233.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_233.text: Karlach! You know what I mean.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_141.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_141.context: NodeContext: Being mean-spirited in an attempt to drive Karlach away, even though he doesn't actually want to do that.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_16.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_16.text: There may be an inferno in you, Karlach, but at the end of the day you've been frigid for a decade, isn't that right?
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_16.context: NodeContext: Being mean-spirited in an attempt to drive Karlach away, even though he doesn't actually want to do that.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_26.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_26.text: You want to try that again? Without being a jackass, maybe?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_252.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_252.context: NodeContext: Masking defensiveness with offensiveness. In truth he really does want what Karlach is offering (to just hang out without having sex) but now that it's within grasp he's floundering. He's blaming her for his feelings of confusion.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_176.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_176.text: What's really going on here, Astarion? Suddenly you're so vicious.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_144.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_144.text: Suddenly? Darling, you haven't been paying attention.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_277.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_277.text: Listen, it's just -... I'm sorry, all right? Is that what you want?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_170.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_170.text: Not being able to touch you, having to slow down, it's all... I'm just not used to it.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_163.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_163.text: Enough. You don't get to talk to me like that.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_83.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_83.text: I am normal. 'Fucked up' is the height of normalcy.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_211.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_211.text: Oh no - don't you tar me with your 'normal' brush. My demons keep me extraordinary.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_211.context: NodeContext: Karlach has punctured Astarion's bad mood with a joke.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_217.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_217.text: I - ...I'm sorry, Karlach. It's just, not being able to touch you - having to slow down, it's... I'm just not used to it.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_217.context: NodeContext: subtext here is on the slowing down. That IS what he wants. But it's hard for him to see that clearly.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_247.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_247.text: So, can you -... I don't know. Help? Show me what to do?
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_247.context: NodeContext: First breakthrough. He's asking for help knowing what to do when you can't jump into bed with someone.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_203.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_203.text: We can just talk. As long as we want. Then we can sleep. Near, but not too near.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_219.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_219.text: Karlach, champion of the Hells, wants to talk and then fall asleep?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_218.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_218.text: My dear, you're much more boring than I gave you credit for.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_140.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_140.text: But maybe that's not a bad thing.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_105.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_105.text: All right, Karlach. Let's try it your way.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black.NodeContext: Gently. He's feeling vulnerable, but sees this might be a chance to feel safe.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_272.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_272.text: I don't know either. This is all just as new for me as it is for you.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_104.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_104.text: Why don't we put ourselves out of this misery and just sleep? If I can at least look at you, I won't have wasted my whole evening.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black.NodeContext: Peak of Astarion sexy toxicity.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_276.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_276.text: Actually, I think I've changed my mind. I'm going to go.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_196.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_196.text: Keep your fangs to yourself, soldier.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_137.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_137.text: I'm having to learn how to slow down. It isn't easy.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_128.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_128.text: Trust me, it's a challenge for both of us.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_151.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_151.text: But what's a sinner to do when faced with the very embodiment of chastity?

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_271.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_271.text: This is - well... you know, I have no idea what to do with you.
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_271.context: NodeContext: AStarion's mask as the flippant libertine is cracking a bit here. He's frustrated but vulnerable here. Because he can't physically seduce or touch KArlach, his usual means of interacting with a person is punctured. He's faced with the reality that he might not know how to handle a situation where he can't bite or seduce his way to the finish line.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_173.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_173.text: I want to be with you so badly.

SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_245.speaker: Astarion
SD_ROM_NightWithAstarion_245.text: Trust me, the feeling is exceptionally mutual.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_60.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_60.text: You made it. Come here - sit with me.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_60.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart is sitting at the side of a cliff or wall, knees up--the player joins, dangling their feet over the edge.
~She smiles, pours a cup, and offers the player a cup of wine hands it to the playerNodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting with a bottle in her hand.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_52.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_52.text: What do you have in mind? Besides the bottle, that is.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_124.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_124.text: I wouldn't dream of missing it.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_25.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_25.text: So eager. I'm surprised it took you this long.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_118.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_118.text: Well, to begin, I think a toast is in order. Any suggestions?
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_118.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting, and pours wine into a pair of cups.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_165.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Glass raised in a toast.NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_120.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_120.text: Very practical. We could've toasted to that every night so far.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_137.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_137.context: NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_123.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_123.text: I suppose I'll find out. To us.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_123.context: NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_78.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_78.text: Very well, have it your way. To friendship.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_78.context: NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_8.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_8.text: Now tell me something about yourself.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_14.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_14.text: And no tadpoles, dragons, marauding goblins, or anything like that. Something about you.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player stares intently into their drink, contemplating an answerNodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_114.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_114.text: Something about me? I'm surprised you cared.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_85.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_85.text: Fishing for blackmail material, that's all.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_85.context: NodeContext: Said with a flirtatious smirk Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_11.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_11.text: Tell her about your death - how you'd been attacked by a Gur tribe and 'saved' by Cazador.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_56.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_56.text: Tell her the darkness inside of you wasn't caused by an accident. It was done out of love for someone.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_64.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_64.text: Don't stop now. Not just as things are getting interesting...

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_110.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_110.text: I'm not sure what else I can say.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_0.text: Sounds like you just need a little more liquid inspiration.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_88.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_88.text: Your turn - I insist. A little give and take is only fair.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_82.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_82.text: Don't laugh... but I'm not quite sure I have anything to share.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_145.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_145.text: When you worship Shar, secrecy is everything. We'll sacrifice our own memories when ordered to.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_18.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_18.text: A lot of the little things... they're lost to me right now.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_115.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_115.text: Do you think your memories will ever come back?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_72.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_72.text: Perhaps, but please - enough about me. Sharing's bad for my complexion.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_136.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_136.text: Wrong. You like night orchids and can't swim. You told me once.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_76.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_76.text: Heh, I did! And you remembered.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_3.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_3.text: It helps me create all new memories.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: The scene transitions as SH and the player continue to bond and talk the night away. Things pick back up just before morning.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_50.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_50.text: Nearly light. The others will be awake soon...
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_50.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player and Shadowheart both layer on the wall, back flat but feet dangling over of the edge as the sun starts to come up
~Shadowheart lifts the wine bottle and gives it one last shake over her mouth, it's empty, she sets it back downNodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_129.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player looks over at Shadowheart, who looks back when she realizes she's being observed

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_127.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_127.context: NodeContext: Coy. Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_2.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_2.text: I hope there'll be more to come.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_37.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_37.text: *She trails off. You read an invitation in her eyes.*
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart looks at the player, after spending a long night getting to know eachother, she wonders how much further she wants this to go, and how much the the player wants to go

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_132.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_132.text: I wish I could kiss you.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_71.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_71.text: You read my mind. But with your fire... our first kiss might be our last.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_55.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_55.text: Karlach. You're very beautiful, you know. I might even kiss you if I valued my life a little less.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_33.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_33.text: But I can be patient, and I think you can too. Who knows what the future will bring our way?
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_33.context: NodeContext: flirtatious but a little chastened

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart and the player kiss. A flicker of her strange magic blossoms as they do.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_106.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_106.context: NodeContext: A hint of worry in her voice. Shadowheart expects any flare of her magic to cause other people pain. She is still sitting.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_53.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_53.text: Good to know. For the future...

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_163.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_163.text: Let's head back. If we must.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_163.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart and the player stand up an walk away from the edge togetherNodeContext: Post-kiss. Shadowheart reluctantly gets to her feet.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_75.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_75.text: I'd like to think that would've happened anyway.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_70.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_70.text: You know, if you want something... I think you should take it.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_69.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_69.context: NodeContext: The player refused to kiss Shadowheart. She tries to stifle her disappointment and stands up.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart sits back up, picking up the bottle of wine and walking away, the player doesn't follow

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_35.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_35.text: You know, if you want something... I think you should take it.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_68.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_68.text: We should do this again sometime.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_61.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_61.text: Oh... yes. I suppose we'll have to.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_46.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_46.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval dropNodeContext: The player failed to pick up on a cue to kiss her. Shadowheart starts to stand up.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_113.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_113.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval dropNodeContext: The player failed to pick up on a cue to kiss her. Shadowheart starts to stand up.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_40.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_40.text: It was just what I needed.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_34.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_34.text: There's no need to thank me.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_158.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_158.text: Just checking for signs of ceremorphosis.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_63.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_63.text: Oh, I'm perfectly fine, but the mood is well and truly dead.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_4.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_4.text: Bashful come the light of day?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_151.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_151.text: The others can wait. I don't want this to end just yet.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_22.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_22.text: Another moment won't kill them, I suppose... Well, it might, but let's take that risk.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_111.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_111.text: I suppose so. Celebration's over - time to pick up the trail again.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_121.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_121.text: That's a convenient way to avoid the question.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_94.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_94.text: But please - enough about me. Sharing's bad for my complexion.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_38.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_38.text: Where I come from, that's frowned upon.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_47.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_47.text: What, you're discouraged from confiding? Talking about your feelings? Sounds... lonely.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_154.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_154.text: Which is why I'm looking for a little company.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_95.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_95.text: Good. A little mystery will keep you on your toes.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_31.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_31.text: Fair enough. I didn't mean to pry.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_155.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_155.text: Oh? And what else do you find to be fair?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_66.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_66.text: You don't waste time, do you?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_59.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_59.text: Straight answers. Got any for me?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_65.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_65.text: Straight answers are overrated. Where's the discovery?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_138.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_138.text: Oh, I see. Think I can't get you to confess? I'm something of an expert.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_138.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down. Said with wry amusement.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_87.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_87.text: We should head back. We might be missed.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_156.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_156.text: I'm sure they'd last another while without us. But if you insist...

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_79.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_79.text: I suppose there's not that much of a rush.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_32.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_32.text: Nothing worthwhile should be rushed anyway.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_166.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_166.text: There's still plenty of wine and the whole night ahead of us.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_108.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_108.text: Well then. Head on back. I'm sure your cold bedroll is missing you terribly.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_159.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_159.text: Tell her about a quiet spot in Avernus you used to visit. Ugly as sin, but at least you could be alone.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_140.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_140.text: I can relate. I think I used to have a place of my own I liked to retreat to... but it slips my mind.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_140.context: NodeContext: Empathetic, with a trace of deja vu.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_122.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_122.text: Lower your guard and describe the desolate beauty of your home: Crèche K'liir.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_164.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_164.text: Merciless, but beautiful in its own way... Sounds familiar.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_109.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_109.text: Relate Mizora's hold over you - and your eagerness to be free.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_161.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_161.text: Does that mean you're spoken for or not? Heh.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_104.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_104.text: Speak of dedication to your clan above all else. A life of honour and duty that supersedes even blood.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_153.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_153.text: I can respect that sort of loyalty. It's not all that removed from what was instilled in me...

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_54.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_54.text: Speak of an uncertain youth, neither fully at home with humans or orcs. A youth that forged resilience, self-reliance.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_112.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_112.text: Share a little memory from growing up in Baldur's Gate.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_142.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_142.text: Seems like you truly know the city. I never got to explore it to my liking.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_119.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_119.text: There are other things we could do besides talk.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_23.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_23.text: Oh, I'm aware. Several come to mind right now... but I'm going to tempt fate and say we can take our time.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_9.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_9.text: Oh, no. I provided the refreshments. You can supply the entertainment.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_150.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_150.text: You can be tricky sometimes, you know.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_24.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_24.text: I know. One of my many fine qualities.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_15.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_15.text: Thank her for the wine and leave.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_117.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_117.text: You... All right, then. More the fool me.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_117.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down, failing to hide her disappointment.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player sets their cup on the ground and walks away, Shadow tips the cup over after the player departs

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_128.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_128.text: I seem to recall a campful of goblins faring very poorly after a toast.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_36.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_36.text: Heh. Not worried, are you? Rest easy.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_126.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_126.text: To not being poisoned - how about that?
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_126.context: NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player drinks deeply from their cup (should match to last SH refill)

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_169.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_169.text: Not one for taking things slowly, I see.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart refills (reuse)NodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_101.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_101.context: NodeContext: A toast, Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_96.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_96.text: Did you think I wouldn't show?

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_80.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_80.text: Lots of people make promises. Few keep them.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_81.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_81.text: Drain the cup in one swallow.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player downs their cup all at once

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_73.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_73.text: Someone's enthusiastic. Maybe I should have brought a barrel.
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart refillsNodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting down.

SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_143.speaker: Shadowheart
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_143.text: I was hoping for a toast. Any suggestions?
SD_ROM_NightWithShadowheart_143.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart is sitting, and pours wine into a pair of cups.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_104.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_104.text: I trust you enjoyed your evening? After all your efforts, it was well-deserved.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_76.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_76.text: It may be some time before you are afforded another such night - there is much to be done.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_60.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_60.text: Moonrise Towers beckons. I've told you all I know, and now I'll join your camp to help you face whatever's to come.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_32.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_32.text: With luck, and the Oak Father's blessings, we might actually survive. Are you ready?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_63.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_63.text: Remind me - what exactly lies ahead?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_14.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_14.text: There is a terrible curse surrounding Moonrise Towers - a shadow curse that drains away all light and life.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_142.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_142.text: Few can resist it without dying, or transforming into shadow beings. You can try to journey overland if you wish, but I strongly advise you you go under.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_19.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_19.text: There is a tunnel leading from the temple of Selûne right down into the Underdark and beyond. The entrance is hidden somewhere in the ruins.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_17.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_17.text: I believe if you find this entrance, you'll discover a route that leads to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_59.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_59.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for the same entrance - they sought an artefact called the Nightsong that was supposed to be housed somewhere down there.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_22.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_22.text: All right. We'd better get moving.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_89.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_89.text: Onward then. We'll speak soon, I'm sure.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_18.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_18.text: It may be some time before you are afforded another such night - there is much to be done, and I promised I would help you however I could.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_131.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_131.text: I knew about your tadpole the moment I saw you. An archdruid knows all that is natural... and unnatural. I have studied this menace for some time, and wish to see it eradicated.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_107.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_107.text: I'm certain a cure for you can be found at Moonrise Towers, but it's... complicated.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_67.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_67.text: The journey, specifically - it's extremely perilous. Though it seems you're well accustomed to navigating danger.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_41.speaker: Karlach
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_41.text: We get a cure and the chance to hit these arseholes where they live? Sounds good.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_20.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_20.text: To get to the Towers, you'll need to pass through a terrible place - a cursed place.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_127.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_127.text: This curse shrouds everything in shadow - you will not find life, light or anything natural there.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_97.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_97.text: Any who linger are twisted by the curse; they become shadow beings - tormented, dangerous souls.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_99.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_99.text: Sounds like I've no choice - I need to find a way through.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_92.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_92.text: You're half-right - you have to get to Moonrise, but you still have a choice of how to get there.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_23.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_23.text: The Absolute's forces can tolerate such a place?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_31.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_31.text: So it seems, though I don't know how. You will have to choose your approach carefully.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_96.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_96.text: You could go overland - along the Risen Road or through the mountains. Easier at first, but you'll run into the shadow curse eventually.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_4.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_4.text: You could also go under. There is a tunnel somewhere in the ruined temple of Selûne. It leads to Moonrise Towers through the Underdark.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_133.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_133.text: Long ago, a man called Ketheric Thorm built a secret stronghold deep down there, before rallying a whole army of Dark Justiciars - Shar worshippers.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_25.speaker: Shadowheart
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_25.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_35.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_35.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_28.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_28.text: From this stronghold, Ketheric's forces could access both the temple of Selûne and Moonrise Towers - but he was defeated before he could launch an attack.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_143.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_143.text: If you can find this place, I'll wager it will reveal a more direct path to Moonrise Towers, and may even bypass the worst of the shadow curse.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_56.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_56.text: I already found the place you're talking about - it's called Grymforge.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_56.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_57.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_57.text: You've already been? Impressive. You'll make me redundant at this rate. What did you find?
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_57.context: NodeContext: Impressed and a little amused at the player's diligence (finding a place before he can even tell them about it)

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_54.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_54.text: I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_54.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player clicked the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_115.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_115.text: That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_109.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_109.text: It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_109.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_138.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_138.text: I would like to join your camp, if you'll allow me. I can offer my skills, my counsel.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_2.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_2.text: I've long sought to return to Moonrise Towers. It seems our fates have aligned.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_16.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_16.text: How do I find this passage through the Underdark?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_108.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_108.text: Say I decide to try this Underdark route after all - how do I get started?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_21.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_21.text: I advise you start in the temple of Selûne - if you find the Dark Justiciars' hidden entrance, it could lead you all the way to Moonrise.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_114.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_114.text: You want to come to Moonrise as well? Why?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_47.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_47.text: Unfinished business, and a lifetime of regret to repair.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_68.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_68.text: I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_48.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_48.text: I spent years researching the curse, trying to put an end to it. Nothing has worked - yet.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_78.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_78.text: If I can join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I can lift this curse, same as you may find a cure for your infection.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_49.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_49.text: Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might uncover this route to Moonrise?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_94.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_94.text: Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_136.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_136.text: But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_51.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_51.text: One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_52.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_52.text: A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_80.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_80.text: It's lost to me. Perhaps in time I can open it up to the world again, but for now, I must help you.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_13.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_13.text: I've chosen a successor as First Druid - Francesca of the High Forest. A bird's already been dispatched to summon her.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_55.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_55.text: First and only Druid. What will Francesca even do here?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_122.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_122.text: She can tend to the grove, help it heal. In time, others will join. Perhaps some day I can return.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_71.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_71.text: A fellow druid. I can count on her to tend to the grove in my absence. Help it heal.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_91.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_91.text: Precisely! Who indeed? You do not know, and neither do any of the others.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_91.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_149.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_149.text: There's nobody in the grove you'd choose?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_113.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_113.text: No. At least, not right now.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_26.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_26.text: What about one of the others? Rath, perhaps?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_84.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_84.text: Rath has promise, but he has a ways to go yet. He wasn't able to stop Kagha by himself. The grove needs experience and a strong hand.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_77.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_77.text: I need her to stay focused on her training - the grove will need a skilled healer in my absence.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_134.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_134.text: The grove needs to move beyond the mistakes of the past. What it needs is an unknown quantity; an outsider who can enforce the Oak Father's teachings without bias.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_36.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_36.text: This is why I chose Francesca. She will restore simplicity and purity to the grove in my absence.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_8.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_8.text: Contrary to how some think of us, we druids can play politics when necessary.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_144.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_144.text: Now, we've quite the journey ahead. Best get started.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_137.speaker: Wyll
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_137.text: Let's not forget the devil Karlach. The Coast is in danger for as long as she's loosed on it. We need to find her - and kill her.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_146.speaker: Lae'zel
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_146.text: Do not be so impatient to move on as Halsin. As ever, the githyanki crèche remains our priority.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_53.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_53.text: Resentment will spring up like mushrooms no matter what I do. You cannot please everyone and you'd be a fool to try.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_100.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_100.text: Sounds like the grove will be in good hands then. We should get going.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_39.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_39.text: Indeed. We've quite the journey ahead of us.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_87.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_87.text: I'm glad you approve - I do not truly care if you approve, but I am glad.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_44.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_44.text: Absolute followers - but that's about all.
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_44.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't click the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_148.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_148.text: Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_37.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_37.text: Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_139.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_139.text: I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_66.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_66.text: I've got more exploring to do.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_129.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_129.text: Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_123.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_123.text: I found the hidden entrance in the temple of Selûne - the way is clear.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_116.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_116.text: I've already found a way into the Underdark. I can pick up the trail from there.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_7.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_7.text: Already...? If only I'd gone with you instead of Aradin.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_98.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_98.text: So how do I find this underground route?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_61.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_61.text: You'll need to pick up where Aradin left off - find the hidden entrance. It's somewhere in the temple of Selûne.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_85.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_85.text: One of the adventurers had a clue to help find it - a dwarf called Brian. It might still be found on his corpse, wherever the goblins left it.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_75.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_75.text: I don't want to risk getting lost in the Underdark - I'll journey overland.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_126.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_126.text: You may reconsider once you see the effects of the curse for yourself.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_82.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_82.text: I never thought I'd say this, but it sounds like the Underdark is the safer route.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_93.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_93.text: Anything is preferable to risking the shadow curse.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_34.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_34.text: The decision is yours, but I'd favour the Underdark. Even a place like that is the lesser evil compared to the shadow-cursed lands.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_24.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_24.text: This shadow curse - does it affect Shar worshippers?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_5.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_5.text: I don't know. Ketheric's followers were defeated or vanished before the effects of the curse took hold.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_105.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_105.text: Are these Sharrans still to be found?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_10.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_10.text: As bones, perhaps. But their hidden structures might still remain.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_130.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_130.text: I know the Underdark - it's lethal. I'll travel overland.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_43.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_43.text: The Underdark's my home. Better to take that route than risk this curse.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_38.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_38.text: There must be another way to cure myself.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_70.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_70.text: By all means - pursue any leads you may have. But I sense all roads will lead to Moonrise.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_3.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_3.text: How are you so sure Moonrise is where I have to go?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_103.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_103.text: Nature speaks to me. Birds report what they've seen. And I've overheard goblins speaking of it, too. Moonrise is at the heart of all this, I'm sure of it.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_65.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_65.text: Moonrise Towers it is then. I'd better make haste.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_69.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_69.text: Wait. There's more you need to know.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_150.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_150.text: I was expecting more from you than a lead towards some distant, dangerous prospect.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_95.speaker: Player
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_95.text: That's it? Just go to this place?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_29.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_29.text: What, were you expecting a spell? A potion? Or perhaps you thought I'd conduct a cack-handed operation on you right here.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_40.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_40.text: I won't be held accountable just because you're naive enough to expect easy answers. Now allow me to continue.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_128.speaker: Halsin
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_128.text: What were you expecting? That I'd mumble a spell or whip out a potion?

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_121.speaker: Shadowheart
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_121.text: I suppose it was too much to hope we were going to be cured here and now. To Moonrise, then.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_79.speaker: Wyll
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_79.text: To Moonrise Towers, then. May the sun and stars guide us.

SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_140.speaker: Astarion
SCO_HalsinMorningAfter_140.text: Finally, we're catching up on our puppet master. And the hunt ends at Moonrise Towers.

SD_SelectNight_0.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_0.text: *The buzz of celebration quiets to a soothing hum as you approach your bunk.*

SD_SelectNight_5.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_5.text: *Your hand was sought by several, but there is only one night ahead.*

SD_SelectNight_18.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_18.text: *Whose company will you seek, at least for tonight?*

SD_SelectNight_4.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_4.text: *Though you seek repose, you needn't spend the night alone.*

SD_SelectNight_15.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_15.text: *There is one who yearns for you in the dark... Who will you seek?*

SD_SelectNight_34.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_34.text: *Your heart skips a beat. What treasures might this night bestow?*
SD_SelectNight_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade to black.

SD_SelectNight_12.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_12.text: Try to push twisting thoughts of Shadowheart from your mind, and seek sleep.

SD_SelectNight_35.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_35.text: *Her mind is certainly an enigma... but would you wish it any other way?*
SD_SelectNight_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_8.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_8.text: While away the night, fantasising where Gale could take you in the Weave.

SD_SelectNight_10.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_10.text: *Or perhaps you will be the one taking him...*
SD_SelectNight_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_6.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_6.text: Spend the night thinking of Karlach.

SD_SelectNight_41.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_41.text: *With a profane flush of arousal, you realise she may well be doing the same.*
SD_SelectNight_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_38.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_38.text: Go to bed, hoping to dream of Wyll.

SD_SelectNight_25.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_25.text: *Somewhere, in a corner of your heart, you suspect he might be dreaming of you, too.*
SD_SelectNight_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_11.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_11.text: Go to bed, thinking of Lae'zel.

SD_SelectNight_27.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_27.text: *Your body aches pleasingly with the memory of past bruises. Perhaps it is the same for her.*
SD_SelectNight_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_22.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_22.text: *You sleep alone, uplifted by memories of your recent triumphs.*
SD_SelectNight_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Start node with fade  to black. No "sleep" animation for this night.

SD_SelectNight_20.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_20.text: *You've picked up a few pleasant memories on your journey, amongst your struggles.*

SD_SelectNight_16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_SelectNight_16.text: I was hoping to find you before you turned in for the night. My blood runs hot after the battle.

SD_SelectNight_2.speaker: Narrator
SD_SelectNight_2.text: *As she looks you up and down, her mind touches yours - you feel her hand at your neck, her lips closing around yours.*

SD_SelectNight_32.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_SelectNight_32.text: In Menzoberranzan, the high-born would prostrate themselves before me for a fleeting taste of my body.

SD_SelectNight_45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_SelectNight_45.text: Be mine tonight, and you will know why.

SD_SelectNight_42.speaker: Player
SD_SelectNight_42.text: I'm afraid I can't - I'd burn you to a crisp.

SD_SelectNight_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_SelectNight_3.text: Ah yes. Your little affliction. How pitiful for you - and disappointing for me.

SD_SelectNight_46.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_SelectNight_46.text: Disappointing. But perhaps you lack the imagination to satisfy me.
SD_SelectNight_46.context: NodeContext: annoyed that her sexual advances have been rejected

CFM_Raiders_7.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_7.text: *As you approach your camp, the raucous celebrations have already begun.*
CFM_Raiders_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player walks up to the camp, overlooking the celebrations

CFM_Raiders_3.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_3.text: *But you are intercepted before you can join the party.*

CFM_Raiders_12.speaker: Wyll
CFM_Raiders_12.text: As I feared - there is no place in your company for us. We want no part of this, or of you.

CFM_Raiders_0.speaker: Wyll
CFM_Raiders_0.text: As I feared - there is no place in your company for me. I want no part of this, or of you.

CFM_Raiders_10.speaker: Karlach
CFM_Raiders_10.text: I didn't escape the Hells to lose my soul to another evil. I can't be part of this anymore.

CFM_Raiders_4.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_4.text: *Volo has fallen into the goblins' clutches again, and appears to be chronicling your misdeeds.*

CFM_Raiders_9.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_9.text: *The goblins praise the Absolute, but their celebrations also honour their leaders. Minthara - and you.*

CFM_Raiders_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CFM_Raiders_2.text: You fought well. And so did these creatures, thanks to our leadership.

CFM_Raiders_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CFM_Raiders_5.text: When you tire of their company, come to me. Tonight, you are mine.

CFM_Raiders_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
CFM_Raiders_1.text: If you tire of their company, come to me. I may have other uses for you yet.

CFM_Raiders_13.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_13.text: *As you approach your camp, the raucous celebrations have already begun.*

CFM_Raiders_8.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_8.text: *Some of your companions have left... perhaps forever.*

CFM_Raiders_11.speaker: Narrator
CFM_Raiders_11.text: *The goblins praise the Absolute, but their celebrations also honour their leaders - including you.*

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_17.text: You're here - good. Come with me.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scene starts at Player's bedroll, leads player to the altar of the AbsoluteNodeContext: An instruction delivered with a flirtatious smile

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_18.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: MTH walks the player up the alter of the Absolute, then turns, inviting them to lie upon itNodeContext: An instruction delivered with a flirtatious smile, domineering

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_65.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_65.text: *An image of her naked body against yours flashes into your mind.*
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara snakes down the players chest while maintaining eye contact

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_84.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_84.text: Do not speak. Just do as I say.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_76.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_76.text: I think we need to know each other a little better first.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_69.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_69.text: I have seen your mind - I know everything I need to know.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_69.context: NodeContext: smiling flirtatiously, totally in control of the situation

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_14.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_14.text: Is this a seduction or a sacrifice?

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_50.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_50.context: NodeContext: with a flirtatious smile, domineering

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_66.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara strokes the player's cheek, then gestues toward the alter and looks at the playerNodeContext: flirtatious and domineering

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lays themselves on the alter of the Absolute as Minthara watches

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_91.text: Your obedience will make this more enjoyable for both of us. Tell me what you want.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara leans over top the player, lifting their head toward her ownNodeContext: flirtatious, domineering

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_9.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara grabs the player and pull them in for a kiss before a fade a blackNodeContext: with a smile, final line before sex scene

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: --fade in--
Minthara and the player embrace, naked.
The player's hand drifts over the small of Minthara's back. Minthara grabs it, pulling it under.
--fade out--

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_25.context:
CinematicNodeContext: --fade in--
Minthara holds the player's head close with her right, releasing their grip to move south--the player respondes to the sensation.
The player player dances their finger playfully across Minthara's ear for a moment.
Minthara turns, kissing it before guiding her head down the player's stomach.
The player's hand moves from the ear gently follow Minthara's head down.
--fade out--

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_102.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_102.text: *As your bodies lock together, so do your minds. Her whole being is laid bare before you.*
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_102.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minthara leans against player, both dozing against the base of the alter
The player looks down toward Minthara, their eyes snapping open

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_51.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_51.text: *And half-hidden at the centre of her desire, you discover something unexpected - fear.*

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_94.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_94.text: *You draw her closer, with all the vim of a lover's first embrace.*
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge facial expression starts to turn... It's a moment of intimate quiet. There is a very slow fade towards the rage graphic as the dark urge seems to fall further into the thought.... once the fade to red or black is complete, there is just a jarring SNAP sound effect.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_43.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_43.text: Don't let the Urge ruin the moment. Desire. Focus on desire.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches down, pulling Minthara's face in for a kiss long kiss before releasing it

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_1.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_1.text: I would have you by my side in Menzoberranzan when our work on the surface is done.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_1.context:
NodeContext: smiling, peaceful. Menzoberranzan ( men-zo-BEAR-an-zon) is her home city

JLatino: I'd like some alt reads for this line that isn't peaceful, where the Absolute has just told her she has to kill the player, so there's a mournful tone to this line.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_70.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_70.text: Speak to me. Tell me what is in your heart.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_70.context: NodeContext: spoken softly, but with a slight urgency

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_54.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_54.text: You don't need to ask. Look. Let our minds touch.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_72.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_72.text: No. I want the truth. I want to hear it in your voice, not in my mind.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_24.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_24.text: Don't you think your mind shows you the truth?

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_111.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_111.text: The Absolute owns my mind. I cannot remember a time when her voice did not fill it. Except tonight... tonight the Absolute was silent.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_111.context: NodeContext: puzzled by her own doubts - 'tonight the Absolute was silent' is a scary thought. The voice of god fell silent for her and she's confused and apprehensive

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_82.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_82.text: I only heard your breath and your voice.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_3.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_3.text: I'm glad we did this - I enjoyed it more than the battle.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_29.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_29.text: There's more to you than I thought.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_74.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_74.text: I wanted a bit of fun, not a heart-to-heart.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_95.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_95.text: Passion - I enjoyed that more than the battle.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_80.text: As did I. During the battle, my mind raced, my blood burned... I was righteous. But tonight, I only heard your breath and your voice.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_80.context: NodeContext: puzzled by her own doubts - 'tonight the Absolute was silent' is a scary thought. The voice of god fell silent for her and she's confused and apprehensive

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_73.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_73.text: The Absolute was silent, and - strange to say - that brought me comfort.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_73.context: NodeContext: this is a scary thought for her - she's very apprehensive, but also curious

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_42.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_42.text: Curiosity - there's more to you than I thought.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_12.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_12.text: I could say the same of you. There is something about you that disturbs me.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_6.context: NodeContext: - she's very apprehensive, but also curious

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_33.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_33.text: *The artefact pulses softly, sending out a warning. It is afraid.*
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: artefact isn't shown - player receives telepathic signal from it. Light mind-meld moment.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_32.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_32.text: The Absolute isn't what you think it is.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_78.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_78.text: Quiet - if She hears you, She will kill us both. I have felt Her love, but I have also seen Her wrath. Those who turn from Her grace die screaming.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_68.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_68.text: Then your doubt is a dangerous thing. Push it to one side.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_62.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_62.context: NodeContext: sad, resigned to not getting answers

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_100.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_100.text: Your question is heresy. You should pray for forgiveness.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_21.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_21.text: You are right... but I cannot deny what my heart tells me.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_10.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_10.text: So much that has happened since I left the Underdark is like a dream of somebody else's life. I... do not know myself anymore.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_4.text: Perhaps that is what I deserve. I have failed Her. The weapon I seek is nowhere to be found.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_15.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_15.text: The weapon you sought - I have it. It blocks Her influence.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_23.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_23.text: If this is a lie, it is a dangerous one. Show me.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_101.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_101.text: Open your mind to her. Reveal all that you know about the artefact.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_56.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_56.text: It screams. It silences the Absolute, and it screams. What is it? What are you?
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Psychic pulse from the artefact - minthara reacts in horrorNodeContext: voice still low, but panicked and horrified

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_52.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_52.text: Not a lie, a test. Your orders are to kill those who have the weapon. Would you kill me?

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_45.text: If She told me to, I would. But I do not hear Her... and perhaps that is a sign that you must live.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_116.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_116.text: Or a sign that She has abandoned me.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_115.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_115.text: The Absolute can't reach you while you're with me.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_44.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_44.text: This is blasphemy... but so much that has happened since I left the Underdark is like a dream of somebody else's life. I... do not know myself anymore.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_114.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_114.text: Except tonight. Tonight, I wanted this - for myself.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_27.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_27.text: I must pray, and you must rest. Tomorrow we will have fresh orders.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara turns her back to the player to pray at the altar when she ends the lineNodeContext: resolute - hopes her prayers will fix everything

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_96.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_96.text: Regret - I wanted a bit of fun, not a heart-to-heart.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_85.text: The moment we were alone together, something changed. I felt it, and you must have felt it too.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_90.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_90.context: NodeContext: this is a scary thought for her - she's very apprehensive, but also curious

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_28.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_28.text: *She flinches as layers of her psyche peel back, revealing the scars of a life spent anticipating a knife in the back.*
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara flinches in her dozing

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_37.speaker: Narrator
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_37.text: *The memories of countless dead, slain too soon - not just enemies, but family, friends, lovers.*

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_67.context:
InternalNodeContext: Minthara wakes with, aware of the invation, and leans forward cold returning
The player is left in their position

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_109.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_109.text: My body could have been yours, but some things are mine alone.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_63.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_63.text: That was not yours to see.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_63.context: NodeContext: she turns her face away - she is shocked, shaken even

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_7.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_7.text: I'm sorry - I meant no harm.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_88.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_88.text: You are incapable of harming me. Get out of my sight.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_19.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_19.text: There's no shame in being afraid.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_36.text: I harnessed my fear long ago - it sharpens me. You would do well to do the same.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_36.context: NodeContext: weary and as close to friendly advice as she ever gets

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands, departing from the alter area

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_48.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_48.text: Not this. I want to leave.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_26.text: Then go - rest. We will discuss our next move in the morning.
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minthara, leaning over the player, steps back, irritated, disappointed and the player walks awayNodeContext: irritated - was hoping to seduce us and got turned down

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_89.speaker: Player
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_89.text: This isn't my idea of a good time.

SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_53.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
SD_ROM_NightWithDrow_53.text: Then leave. You would only have disappointed me.
